content.description:
Start crouched with both hands in the angled seam. Climb through an engaging mix of physical and balancy movements straight up to the summit. Do not bail left underneath the shallow roof once you reach the crimps.

This is one of my favorite climbs in the entire SB area, but that is likely due as much to the climbing as the amount of effort it took to clean and solve this problem.

Similar to the Conch, I have a hard time determining the difficulty of this problem. It is unlike most other climbs in SB, and hence I don't have much to compare it to. Second, third, fourth, etc. opinions would be most welcome.
content.location: On the same boulder as Ballet Lessons, but on the opposite (inland facing/North) side. From The Brute follow the trail downhill towards the base of the canyon. This problem will be on your left as you walk down the hill. About 40 feet downhill from the Brute Boulder.

content.description:
Start in the chest high break using whichever holds appeal to you. Make a big move up and right to a good incut in the overhanging face, move a bit right to the lip, mantel over and take a victory lap up somewhat suspect rock to the summit. Invigorating, particularly the mantle over the lip.

The grade reflects my opinion of the difficulty if you do not have to jump to the first incut. If, however, you are short, this will likely be substantially more difficult.
content.location: From Roadhouse Blues, walk downcanyon a bit more before you can start angling back up the hill toward the ocean. The boulder with Rumspringa will be on your right. It's pretty darn large. You'll find it.

content.description:
Start sitting with your right hand on the obvious orange jug and your left in a sloping undercling in the hueco under the low roof. Head left to a knob hold and then bust up to a sloping topout. A wonderful little compression problem.

Surprisingly fun and full value for a smaller boulder. Reminds me of High Hat.
content.location: Will be on your left as you walk down the shallow canyon. About 100 yards downhill of Dan's Boulder.

content.description:
Sit start matched in the obvious large orange jug. Set a foot and move up and slightly right to immediately top out the boulder.

The holds are quite nice, I only wish there was some more climbing between starting and finishing.
content.location: Sit in the same place as you would to start Roadhouse Blues

content.description: Start low on the arete on the right side. Pull on, and utilize the some compression with a unique gaston sequence to bypass the blank part of the face, then continue up and left finally topping out the bulge on good holds.
content.protection:
Pads and spotters.

One rock in the landing near the end, but it is fairly flat so can be pretty easily padded.

Maybe not PG13, but bold for sure.
content.location:
Far end of the Inner Canyon. From Highway, look towards La Cumbre Peak. O.G. Arete is the overhanging bent prow straight that way.

OR go to Debra, then head downhill (away from the ocean) for a few minutes.

content.description: A must do for anyone who enjoyed the Original Generation Arete. Starts seated on the opposite arete adding a couple burly compression moves to link up with the OG Arete.
content.protection: i generally enjoy having an ocean of pads but you could get away with just 2 or 3 i imagine
content.location: Left arete of the OG Arete Boulder

content.description:
Start as for Abe's Oddysee, at the lowest point of the overhang on the giant undercling sidepull. Continue straight up passed the jug flakes to a small but decent left hand crimp, do a big pull to gain a perfect crimp out right and another huge pull and slap for the sloper. Pull the lip and finish on the spooky slab.

Surely a neo-Potters' classic! Full value! No refunds!
content.protection: Pads. Spotters. Don't fall off the slab (into the tree!)
content.location: Backside of the same boulder as Rummspringa. Walk all the way around, and look for the overhang.

content.description: An oddysee of jugs, crimps, overhang and slab. Start all the way at the lowest point of the cave on a giant undercling sidepull. Follow jug flakes up and to the left, and make a crux lip encounter to the hole. Surmount the lip and continue the journey through the spooky slab to the top (up left, or up and right if you dare).
content.protection: Pads. Good spotter. Don't fall off the slab!
content.location:
This boulder is in the Upper Canyon, but down a few minutes from Roadhouse Blues.

On the backside of the giant boulder that also has Rumspringa.
